intro: Ionidium capense, commonly known as the Cape ionidium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Ionidium capense thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
